nodes.documentation:
@dev All public functions have to use the inState() modifier to prevent
invalid state transitions. Besides open(), they also have to use an
onlyX() modifer to only let allowed parties call. If they depend on a
timeout constraint, the have to use a within/afterTimeout() modifier.

nodes.name: getChannel

nodes.documentation:
@notice generates a deterministic channel id for a channel between _A and
  _B, using seed _idSeed.
  Channels are saved to the channels map at this id, having the effect
  that a channel id can never belong to a different pair of channel
  parties.
nodes.name: genId

arguments.value: Bogus timeout duration.

nodes.documentation:
@notice returns the channel update message to sign by each party.
  Mimic this in your off-chain application.
  Note that the channel id already encodes the parties of the channel, so
  we don't need to add them to the message digest.
nodes.name: ethSignedMsgHash

nodes.documentation:
@notice returns the channel update message to sign by each party.
  Mimic this in your off-chain application.
  Note that the channel id already encodes the parties of the channel, so
  we don't need to add them to the message digest.
nodes.name: ethSignedMsgHash

devdoc.author: Sebastian Stammler, Marius van der Wijden
devdoc.details: This is a single-deployment version of payment channels, where each  channel state resides at its own uint id in the channels mapping.  The channel initiator is sometimes referred to as A, the confirmer as B.

params._counterParty: The channel's other side, who needs to confirm the channel.
params._idSeed: seed that is used to calculate the channel id, which will  be genId(msg.sender, _counterParty, _idSeed)
params._timeoutDuration: duration of confirmations of channel opening  and closing

devdoc.title: Perun Ledger Payment Channels

closeInitialBalance(uint256).notice: Initiates closing of channel _id without updating the initial  balance. This is like close() without the udpate.  Transitions: Open -> ClosingByX

ethSignedMsgHash(uint256,uint256,uint256.notice: returns the channel update message to sign by each party.  Mimic this in your off-chain application.  Note that the channel id already encodes the parties of the channel, so  we don't need to add them to the message digest.

genId(address,address,uint256).notice: generates a deterministic channel id for a channel between _A and  _B, using seed _idSeed.  Channels are saved to the channels map at this id, having the effect  that a channel id can never belong to a different pair of channel  parties.

getChannel(uint256).notice: Public getter for LedgerChannels. Primarily used for testing.

open(uint256,uint48,address,uint256).notice: opens request to open a payment channel by the sender of the tx.  Sent ether is blocked in the opening channel as A's balance.  The id of this channel will be genId(msg.sender, _counterParty, _idSeed)

userdoc.notice: Single-deployment ledger payment channels contract.  Allows two parties to block ether in a payment channel and execute  off-chain transactions within this channel.
